section.title: Using a Local VHD Cache to Accelerate VM Download from &BACKEND;
section.para: When a VM download from &BACKEND; is initiated, &PB; attempts to locate VHDs in an attached optical disk or USB drive which would otherwise have to be downloaded from &BACKEND;. Using a local VHD cache in this manner can greatly speed up the installation of a VM image onto a device. Use the following procedure to create a local VHD cache:

procedure.title: To Prepare a Local VHD Cache

step.para: Create, prepare, and upload a VM to &BACKEND;.
To identify which VHD files are used by the VM, open the local command shell in the console on your &BACKEND; appliance, then run the following command:

note.para: Use double quotes around vm_name if it contains whitespace.

step.para: The paths to all the VHDs associated with the specified VM are displayed.
Copy the VHDs to a USB drive or burn them to an optical disk. The USB drive must be formatted with an NTFS filesystem. For DVDs, please burn the VHDs to a UDF filesystem. Ensure that:

listitem.para: The VHD filenames are not changed.
The VHD files are present in the root folder of the medium.

step.para: It is also possible to cache a portion of a VHD file if it is too large for the cache medium. For example, if you have a 4.3 GB VHD file and a 4 GB USB drive, you can use the split command in a console on your &BACKEND; server:
to split the VHD into two files, xenclientaa and xenclientbb:
step.screen: ls -lh total 8.6G -rwxr-xr-x 1 hsimpson xeneng 4.3G Dec 14 2010 example.vhd -rw-r--r-- 1 hsimpson xeneng 4.0G Jul 13 15:47 xenclientaa -rw-r--r-- 1 hsimpson xeneng 356M Jul 13 15:48 xenclientab
step.para: You can then rename xenclientaa to example.vhd and put it on the cache medium. When a download is initiated, &PB; first searches for a USB drive that contains a portion or all of the required VHD(s), then for a optical media drive, and then that falls back to downloading any remaining VHDs or portions thereof from &BACKEND;.

note.para: For successful VHD cache reading, it is essential that the first portion of any VHD is present on the cache medium. For example, putting the xenclientab file only onto the cache medium will cause the image transfer to fail.

step.para: Assign the VM image to a user.
Insert the USB device or optical disk into the user's &PB; device, and initiate the VM image download.
